items: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand.
Extend your arms out to the sides, parallel to the floor, with your palms facing down.
Keeping your arms straight, lift the weights up and out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the weights back down to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Targets the lateral deltoid muscle, which is responsible for shoulder abduction and helps create a wider shoulder appearance
Allows for a greater range of motion compared to dumbbell lateral raises
Provides constant tension on the muscle throughout the movement, leading to greater muscle activation and potential growth
Can be easily adjusted to target different areas of the lateral deltoid by changing the angle of the cable or the height of the pulley
Engages the core muscles for stability and balance during the exercise
